Articles.Content:
I have recently become a fan of KSP and there are a few of my suggestions for the game that I would like to bring to your attention.

First of all, and I'm sure many will agree that it is frustrating when you time warp past a node, perhaps we could have a "set time" time-warp where one could enter the amount of time to warp by or even just make the warp hit times 1 as soon as it reaches the node or a minute before.

Secondly is a question regarding the repairs kerbals can do in the future, will they be able to pick up objects that have fallen next to their pod and have not been obliterate to weld them back onto the pod and fly another day.

Lastly, I really like how the 3 main kerbals (Bill, Bob and Jeb) wear the only orange suits, perhaps a random colour scheme for future kerbals but keeping orange strictly for the founding 3.

That's all I've really thought of, great game, keep up the massive amount of work I'm sure the whole team is doing.
on 3, I'm hoping they tie the colour of the suits to a given kerbals experience in your space program.
You may want to look into the Kerbal Alarm Clock mod, which does help with things like not missing nodes.
I`m up for the colour of suit matching experience, Kerbal Alarm Clock is invaluable for not missing nodes and I like the idea of picking up parts on EVA and welding them back on!

I"d like to see something like Kerbal Alarm Clock implemented into the vanilla experience. Especially if I can toggle it on and off 'cause sometimes it doesn't matter as much if I miss a maneuver node, like if I'm trying to get to Mun or something. But if I'm trying to get to another planet, it's kind of important I leave at a certain time, right?

As for the suit colors, it's been suggested before that we have the ability to customize our kerbonauts' suit colors. Of course, a lot of people prefer the white for EVA 'cause it's all realistic and stuff and would just want to see orange suits for launches, white suits for EVA, blue polo shirts or something for IVA in stations and so on. Me, I'm in the full-on customization camp 'cause it's just fun. Doesn't remove anything from the game experience, the realists or whatever you'd like to call them can keep their real-world clothing colors and the weridos like me can paint their EVA suits bright pink if we wanted to. Would feel good man.

Im all for different suits. It'd also be nice if each Kerbonaut had an experience log, i.e. where they've been and how many times they've been to space, how many 'space-hours' they've logged and stuff. Suits could then be coloured accordingly :-). I'm also entirely in favor of the idea of just being able to customise the IVA suits entirely by yourself. Maybe even the EVA suits like in the Universe Replacer mod, only where it's controllable which Kerbal gets which suit instead of random.

Also, the Kerbal Alarm Clock in vanilla would be nice. When i was less experienced, i tried to make a Mun escape to return to Kerbin. I'd had a weird exit vector though, so i was waiting a while till the Mun was clear, so i could burn retro and not re-enter it's sphere of influence. I accidentally timewarped too fast, leading them to orbit Kerbin multiple times and get right on an collision course with the Mun with not enough fuel to steer clear of it.

Doesn't remove anything from the game experience, the realists or whatever you'd like to call them can keep their real-world clothing colors and the weridos like me can paint their EVA suits bright pink if we wanted to. Would feel good man.

Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous! ^^
I agree with the Time Warp suggestion. 30 seconds before the node, the Time Warp should drop to 1x. This would be very simple to implement.
